intro: Digitalis transiens var. dyris, commonly known as the hybrid foxglove, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the genus Digitalis, which includes several species of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae. The plant is characterized by its tall spikes of tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
